text.__SUMMARY__: Hypericum addingtonii is a species of shrub in the genus Hypericum. It is found in China and was described by Norman Robson in 1985.
text.Description: Hypericum addingtonii ranges from 1.5–2 meters in height. Its stems are yellow-brown.
text.Distribution and habitat: The species is found in parts of China, in northwestern and western Yunnan bamboo thickets, grassy slopes, and hemlock forest edges.
text.Name:
Hypericum addingtonii is known as die hua jin si tao in Chinese and Addington hypericum in English. It was named for its collector, P. Addington.
